Spears began her career as a child actress, when she played [[Zoey Brooks]] on the [[Nickelodeon]] teen sitcom ''[[Zoey 101]]'' (2005‚Äì2008),{{Cite web |last=Hiramine |first=Brie |date=2016-06-28 |title="Zoey 101" Reunion: Jamie Lynn Spears Has Not Discussed It Yet |url=https://www.j-14.com/posts/zoey-101-reunion-jamie-lynn-spears-has-not-discussed-it-yet-106482/ |access-date=2023-12-16 |website=J-14 |language=en-US}} and later reprised her role as Zoey Brooks in the sequel film ''[[Zoey 102]]'' (2023). She plays [[Sweet Magnolias#Main|Noreen Fitzgibbons]] on the [[Netflix]] romantic [[Drama (film and television)|drama]] series ''[[Sweet Magnolias]]'' (2020‚Äìpresent). She is the recipient of several accolades, including a [[Gracie Awards|Gracie Award]], two [[Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards|Kids Choice Awards]] and two [[Young Artist Award|Young Artist Awards]]. She is the younger sister of singer [[Britney Spears]]. Beginning in December 2007, Spears was subject to significant media attention and controversy after announcing her pregnancy at age 16. A misconception emerged that this canceled ''Zoey 101''; however, the [[Zoey 101 (season 4)|final season]] wrapped filming in September 2007 and premiered the following year. After giving birth in 2008, Spears stopped acting for five years.{{cite web|author=Starr Bowenback|url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/a34415829/jamie-lynn-spears-why-zoey-101-end-pregnancy|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Says 'Zoey 101' Didn't End Because She Was Pregnant|work=Cosmopolitan|date=October 19, 2020|access-date=July 27, 2021|archive-date=July 28, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210728000921/https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/a34415829/jamie-lynn-spears-why-zoey-101-end-pregnancy/|url-status=live}} Spears returned from her hiatus in 2013 and began her music career. She released her debut single "[[How Could I Want More]]" from her debut [[extended play|EP]] in [[country music]], ''[[The Journey (Jamie Lynn Spears EP)|The Journey]]'' (2014). In 2015, Spears earned songwriting credits for [[Jana Kramer]]'s [[RIAA certification|certified Platinum]] single, "[[I Got the Boy]]", a song she wrote in 2011 during writing sessions in [[Nashville]] for her 2013 EP.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/jamie-lynn-spears-on-sharing-her-boy-with-jana-kramer-20150424|title=Jamie Lynn Spears on Sharing Her 'Boy' With Jana Kramer |magazine=Rolling Stone|author=Deborah Evans Price|date=April 24, 2015|access-date=September 3, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908105127/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/jamie-lynn-spears-on-sharing-her-boy-with-jana-kramer-20150424|archive-date=September 8, 2015|url-status=live}} In 2023, due to the [[SAG-AFTRA]] strike, Spears began to appear on reality television shows, such as ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'', ''[[Special Forces: World's Toughest Test]]'' and ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (British TV series)|I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!]].''{{Cite web |title=Jamie Lynn Spears leaves I'm A Celebrity on medical grounds |url=https://news.sky.com/story/jamie-lynn-spears-leaves-im-a-celebrity-on-medical-grounds-13018993 |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=Sky News |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Knolle |first=Sharon |date=2023-11-14 |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Joins UK Reality Series 'I'm a Celebrity' |url=https://www.thewrap.com/jamie-lynn-spears-im-a-celebrity-get-me-out-of-here/ |access-date=2023-12-15 |website=TheWrap |language=en-US |quote=I think it is so far out of my comfort zone and this year with SAG being on strike, I have said ‚Äòyes‚Äô to a lot of unscripted projects. I am really enjoying throwing myself into these experiences.}} == Early life == Spears was born in [[McComb, Mississippi]],{{cite web|url= https://www.allmusic.com/artist/jamie-lynn-spears-mn0003195849/biography|title= Jamie Lynn Spears Biography|first= Mark|last= Deming|publisher= [[AllMusic]]|access-date= August 26, 2020|archive-date= August 26, 2021|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20210826033510/https://www.allmusic.com/artist/jamie-lynn-spears-mn0003195849/biography|url-status= live}} and raised in [[Kentwood, Louisiana]],{{cite web|url=https://www.biography.com/people/jamie-lynn-spears-262390|title=Jamie Lynn Spears ‚Äì Actress, Film Actress, Singer, Television Actress|publisher=[[Biography.com]]|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140404172557/http://www.biography.com/people/jamie-lynn-spears-262390|archive-date=April 4, 2014|access-date=April 2, 2014}} to [[Jamie Spears|Jamie]] and [[Lynne Spears]]. Her older siblings are [[Bryan Spears|Bryan]] and [[Britney Spears|Britney]].{{Cite magazine|url=https://people.com/music/jamie-lynn-spears-throwback-big-sister-britney-treatment/|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Shares Throwback Photo with Her Big Sister as Britney Seeks Wellness Treatment|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|access-date=April 24, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190417191241/https://people.com/music/jamie-lynn-spears-throwback-big-sister-britney-treatment/|archive-date=April 17, 2019|url-status=live|quote=...her father Jamie, 66.... her parents, Jamie and Lynne, 63...}} Her parents divorced in 2002, but were in an [[On-again, off-again relationship|on-and-off relationship]] after the divorce.{{Cite web |title=Jamie Lynn Spears on Healing After Past Trauma and Mental Health Struggles: I've Found 'Peace' |url=https://people.com/country/jamie-lynn-spears-on-healing-after-past-trauma-and-mental-health-struggles/ |access-date=2023-11-16 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}} She has described her home life as unstable, but remembers "feeling very loved". She attended [[Parklane Academy]] in McComb, where she was a [[Cheerleading|cheerleader]], and point guard of the basketball team.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2005/01/09/arts/television/for-young-viewers-surfs-up-at-school-so-lets-all-be-cool.html|title=FOR YOUNG VIEWERS; Surf's Up At School, So Let's All Be Cool|last=Renner|first=Lisanne|date=January 9, 2005|work=The New York Times|access-date=April 24, 2019|issn=0362-4331|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190424171950/https://www.nytimes.com/2005/01/09/arts/television/for-young-viewers-surfs-up-at-school-so-lets-all-be-cool.html|archive-date=April 24, 2019|url-status=live}} She was enrolled in dance and voice lessons, and participated in school plays and church performances.{{Cite book |last=Spears |first=Jamie Lynn |title=Things I Should Have Said |year=2022 |quote=Perhaps my love of playing characters stems from a desire to abandon my stressors and escape to other worlds. Anytime I quieted my thoughts to take on another persona, I felt transformed. The freeing sensation only added to my enjoyment. I improved my talent by infusing fun into everything I created. The hours I spent developing characters helped me form a clearer view of my future. I always sought out ways to get in front of an audience. School plays, church performances, and even local auditions served as my training ground. I took whatever parts I could get.}} As a child, Spears and her family also spent time traveling and touring with Britney.{{Cite book |last=Spears |first=Jamie Lynn |title=Things I Should Have Said |language=English |quote=When we weren‚Äôt out on tour or managing the business, we would return home to just be a family. I loved going on tour as long as I was with my family or could bring a friend along, but I preferred being home.}} Spears studied with tutors while filming ''[[Zoey 101]]'' in Los Angeles.{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1579257/jamie-lynn-spears-makes-first-public-appearance-since-pregnancy-bombshell/|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Makes First Public Appearance Since Pregnancy Bombshell|last=Archive-Chris-Harris|website=MTV News|access-date=April 24, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190424171950/http://www.mtv.com/news/1579257/jamie-lynn-spears-makes-first-public-appearance-since-pregnancy-bombshell/|archive-date=April 24, 2019|url-status=dead}} She finished her education via online correspondence{{cite web |last=Kliff |first=Sarah |title=The Other Ms. Spears |url=http://www.newsweek.com/id/41949 |work=Newsweek |date=October 2, 2007 |access-date=December 18, 2007 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071224141841/http://www.newsweek.com/id/41949 |archive-date=December 24, 2007 |url-status=live }} and received her [[GED]] in February 2008 through [[Tangipahoa Parish School Board|Tangipahoa Parish School System]] Adult Education Center.{{cite web|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Passes Her GED Exam|url=https://people.com/celebrity/jamie-lynn-spears-passes-her-ged-exam/|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|first=Ruth|last=Laney|date=February 25, 2008|access-date=November 21, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180115001659/http://people.com/celebrity/jamie-lynn-spears-passes-her-ged-exam/|archive-date=January 15, 2018|url-status=live}} == Career == === 2002‚Äì2008: Career beginnings and success with ''All That'' and ''Zoey 101'' === In February 2002, at age 10, Spears made her acting debut in the [[Paramount Pictures]] drama film ''[[Crossroads (2002 film)|Crossroads]]'' which starred her sister, who portrayed the central character Lucy Wagner. Spears made a cameo, playing the younger version of Britney's character.{{cite web|title=Britney's Kid Sister Revving Up Career|url=https://people.com/celebrity/britneys-kid-sister-revving-up-career/|first=Stephen M.|last=Silverman|work=People|access-date=September 24, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180308041322/http://people.com/celebrity/britneys-kid-sister-revving-up-career/|archive-date=March 8, 2018|url-status=live}} In April 2002, Spears walked the runway as a model for [[Kids R Us]] [[fashion show]] in New York City.{{Cite web |title=Growing Up Spears |url=https://people.com/celebrity/growing-up-spears/ |access-date=2023-09-12 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}} Following ''Crossroads'', [[Nickelodeon]] cast Spears as a regular performer in the sketch comedy series ''[[All That]]'' for the 2002 season; she appeared on the show through 2004.{{Cite web |last=Dugan |first=Christina |date=2019-11-21 |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Set to Reunite with Zoey 101 Cast on Nickelodeon's All That |url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/jaime-lynn-spears-set-reunite-200024248.html |access-date=2023-09-04 |website=Yahoo! |language=en-US}} Spears portrayed various roles through the two seasons she appeared.{{Cite web|last=McCarthy|first=Lauren|title=Jamie Lynn Spears On New Music, Her Family, And That 'Zoey 101' Reboot|url=https://www.nylon.com/entertainment/jamie-lynn-spears-zoey-101-reboot-new-music|access-date=October 20, 2020|website=Nylon|date=October 19, 2020 |language=en|archive-date=October 20, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201020022234/https://www.nylon.com/entertainment/jamie-lynn-spears-zoey-101-reboot-new-music|url-status=live}} Along with the cast of ''All That'', Spears also made appearances on ''[[SNICK|Snick On-Air Dare]]'', Nickelodeon's version of ''[[Fear Factor]]''.{{Cite book |last=Spears |first=Jamie Lynn |title=Things I Should Have Said |publisher=Worthy Publishing |year=2022 |pages=27 |quote=A few times I took part in On-Air Dare, Nickelodeon's version of Fear Factor that aired during SNICK. I had to attempt to drink five gallons of blue cheese dressing, be doused in eggs, and eat "earwax tacos," all in the name of entertainment.}} Deciding to pursue other roles on the network, Spears departed from the main cast on the tenth and final season of ''All That'', and only appeared as a guest. At age 13, Spears was named as one of the celebrities on ''[[People (magazine)|Teen People]]'''s Young Hollywood/Hot List. [[File:Jamie Lynn Spears.jpg|thumb|upright=0.7|Spears in 2007]] In August 2004, Spears signed a development deal with [[Nickelodeon]] in which she would star as the protagonist in her own scripted television series that would air on the network. The series went on to be titled ''[[Zoey 101]]'' and Spears portrayed the role of [[Zoey Brooks]]. The series centered on Zoey and her friends who attend a fictional boarding school, Pacific Coast Academy (PCA). Spears recorded the series theme song, titled "Follow Me", which was written by her sister [[Britney Spears]]. Filmed at [[Pepperdine University]] in [[Malibu, California|Malibu]], California, the series premiered on January 9, 2005, and was the network's highest-rated series premiere in over eight years. Spears won a [[Young Artist Award]] and a [[Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards]] for her performance.{{cite press release|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080716014129/http://www.nickkcapress.com/2004KCA/index.php|via = [[Wayback Machine|The Wayback Machine]]|url =http://www.nickkcapress.com/2004KCA/index.php|archive-date = July 16, 2008| title=Top honors at Nickelodeon's 17th annual Kid's Choice Awards|year=2005|publisher=Nickelodeon Kids Choice Awards|access-date=September 25, 2009}} In September 2007, she won "The High School Sweetheart" award at ''[[Us Weekly]]'''s Hot Hollywood event.{{Cite web |date=2007-10-21 |title=Usmagazine.com {{!}} 2007 Hot Hollywood Power Players |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/hot_hollywood_power_players |access-date=2023-09-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071021055558/http://www.usmagazine.com/hot_hollywood_power_players |archive-date=October 21, 2007 }}{{Cite web |date=2007-12-22 |title=Usmagazine.com {{!}} Us Hot Hollywood Power Players 2007 ‚Äì Jamie Lynn Spears: The High School Sweetheart |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/power_players_jamie_lynn_spears |access-date=2023-09-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071222123536/http://www.usmagazine.com/power_players_jamie_lynn_spears |archive-date=December 22, 2007 }}{{Cite web |last2= |last3= |last4= |date=2007-12-31 |title=Jamie Lynn Spears is not the first teen to have a baby |url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-jamielynn31dec31-story.html |access-date=2023-09-12 |website=Los Angeles Times |language=en-US}} ''Zoey 101'' was positively received by critics and viewers. It was nominated for an [[Emmy Awards|Emmy for Outstanding Children's Programming]], and the show's season 3 finale episode was the second most-watched show across all cable channels that week. The series ran for four seasons, with its series finale "[[List of Zoey 101 episodes#ep61|PCA Confidential]]" airing on May 2, 2008. [[Nickelodeon]] issued a statement shortly after the announcement of Spears being pregnant at the age of 16, stating that the network respected Spears's decision to take responsibility and noting that its primary concern was for her well-being.{{cite magazine|title=Britney's Teen Sister Jamie Lynn Spears Pregnant|url=https://people.com/parents/britneys-teen-sister-jamie-lynn-spears-pregnant/|magazine=People|access-date=November 21, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191202063401/https://people.com/parents/britneys-teen-sister-jamie-lynn-spears-pregnant/|archive-date=December 2, 2019|url-status=live}}{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.teenvogue.com/story/jamie-lynn-spears-explained-real-reason-zoey-101-ended|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Refutes a Longstanding Theory About Why "Zoey 101" Ended|last=Lusti|first=Hanna|date=January 10, 2019|magazine=Teen Vogue|language=en|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190424171951/https://www.teenvogue.com/story/jamie-lynn-spears-explained-real-reason-zoey-101-ended|archive-date=April 24, 2019|access-date=April 24, 2019}} Spears' co-star Seann Flynn praised her as hard-working and talented, telling ''[[Nylon (magazine)|Nylon]]'': "One of the things that always stood out to me regarding her professionalism was how well she knew her lines. I don‚Äôt think she ever messed one up. She always brought her best work to the table." In December 2007, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' announced that Spears had signed on to guest-appear in the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] comedy sitcom series ''[[Miss Guided]]'', in which she played the role of the promiscuous high-school student Mandy Fener in the episode "Hot Sub" which aired on March 20, 2008. That same year, Spears voiced Goldilocks in the direct-to-DVD [[animation film]] ''[[Unstable Fables: Goldilocks & 3 Bears Show]]''. === 2011‚Äì2017: Country music debut === [[File:Jamie Lynn Spears 2011.png|thumb|150px|Spears performing in 2011|left]] In 2011, Spears moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] and began working on a country music album with local music producers. On November 7, 2011, Spears held a small concert at The Rutledge in Nashville.{{cite news |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Makes Country Music Debut |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/general-news/jamie-lynn-spears-country-music-nashville-britney-259537/#! |access-date=19 May 2023 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=9 November 2011}} On November 25, 2013, Spears released her first single "[[How Could I Want More]]".{{cite news|last=Michaels|first=Sean|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2013/nov/21/britney-spears-jamie-lynn-spears-country-album|title=Britney Spears's little sister Jamie Lynn to record a country album|date=November 21, 2013|work=The Guardian|access-date=November 26, 2013|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203081737/http://www.theguardian.com/music/2013/nov/21/britney-spears-jamie-lynn-spears-country-album|archive-date=December 3, 2013}}{{cite tweet|title=SURPRISE! As a part of her since-removed 2018 year in review Instagram story highlight, Jamie Lynn posted a picture on her Instagram dated Feb. 18, 2018, captioned 'pregnancy + RCIA. Worth it.'|archive-date=August 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210807192933/https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/248608/britney-spears-says-she-is-catholic-now-in-social-media-post|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|date=August 6, 2021|title=Britney Spears reveals she's now Catholic as she models mass dress|url=https://www.newsweek.com/britney-spears-reveals-shes-now-catholic-she-models-mass-dress-1616859|access-date=August 8, 2021|website=Newsweek|language=en|archive-date=August 8, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210808045544/https://www.newsweek.com/britney-spears-reveals-shes-now-catholic-she-models-mass-dress-1616859|url-status=live}} In 2013, Spears was diagnosed with [[anxiety]], depression, and [[obsessive-compulsive disorder]]. She underwent therapy and briefly used medication as well. "The anxiety was to the point where I couldn't function," she commented. "I'm very conscious not to lie to myself anymore because I think that my biggest issue my whole life was pretending to be perfect." === Teenage pregnancy === On December 20, 2007, in an interview with ''[[OK!]]'' magazine, Spears announced that she was pregnant by her then boyfriend, Casey Aldridge.{{cite magazine|title=World Exclusive: Jamie Lynn Spears ‚Äî I'm Pregnant|magazine=[[OK!]]|url=http://www.ok-magazine.com/news/view/3425 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071220164754/http://www.ok-magazine.com/news/view/3425 |url-status=dead |archive-date=December 20, 2007 |access-date=December 22, 2007 }} She was 16 years old at the time. Aldridge, whom she had been dating for two years, was 18.{{cite magazine|title=Who Is Casey Aldridge?|url=https://people.com/parents/who-is-casey-aldridge/|magazine=People|first=Steve|last=Helling|access-date=November 21, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191202111646/https://people.com/parents/who-is-casey-aldridge/|archive-date=December 2, 2019|url-status=live}} Spears confirmed her engagement to Aldridge in March 2008.{{cite news |last1=Lambert |first1=Mark |last2=Dennis |first2=Alicia |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Shows Off New Engagement Ring to Friends |url=https://people.com/celebrity/jamie-lynn-spears-shows-off-new-engagement-ring-to-friends/ |date=March 25, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191023002230/https://people.com/celebrity/jamie-lynn-spears-shows-off-new-engagement-ring-to-friends/ |archive-date=October 23, 2019}} In May 2008, the couple moved to [[Liberty, Mississippi]], and purchased a house, with Spears stating they would raise their child there.{{cite magazine |title=Exclusive: Jamie Lynn & Maddie Home in Mississippi |url=http://www.okmagazine.com/2008/06/ok-exclusive-jamie-lynn-maddie-home-in-mississippi-7467/ |magazine=[[OK!]] |date=June 22, 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110315023756/http://www.okmagazine.com/2008/06/ok-exclusive-jamie-lynn-maddie-home-in-mississippi-7467/ |archive-date=March 15, 2011}} She gave birth to their daughter Maddie Briann Aldridge on June 19, 2008, in McComb, Mississippi.{{cite magazine|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Has a Baby Girl|url=https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-has-a-baby-girl/|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|first=Mary|last=Margaret|date=June 19, 2008|access-date=November 21, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190826235011/https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-has-a-baby-girl/|archive-date=August 26, 2019|url-status=live}}{{cite news |title=Jamie Lynn Sprouts! |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b2141_jamie_lynn_sprouts.html |agency=E! News |date=June 19, 2008 |access-date=November 9, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090702030013/http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b2141_Jamie_Lynn_Sprouts.html |archive-date=July 2, 2009 |url-status=live }}{{cite magazine |title=Jamie Lynn Welcomes a Daughter! |url=http://www.okmagazine.com/news/view/7236 |magazine=[[OK!]] |date=June 19, 2008 |access-date=January 29, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090302041105/http://www.okmagazine.com/news/view/7236 |archive-date=March 2, 2009 |url-status=live }} Spears and Aldridge ended their engagement in March 2009,{{cite magazine |title=Jamie Lynn & Casey: The Wedding's Off! |url=http://www.okmagazine.com/2009/03/jamie-lynn-casey-the-weddings-off-12820/ |magazine=[[OK!]] |date=March 25, 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091009101233/http://www.okmagazine.com/2009/03/jamie-lynn-casey-the-weddings-off-12820/ |archive-date=October 9, 2009}}{{cite news |title=Wedding's off! Jamie Lynn Spears, Casey Aldridge disengaged |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/gossip/2009/03/26/2009-03-26_weddings_off_jamie_lynn_spears_casey_ald-1.html |work=[[New York Daily News|Daily News]]|location=New York City |date=March 26, 2009 |access-date=September 25, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090815131652/http://www.nydailynews.com/gossip/2009/03/26/2009-03-26_weddings_off_jamie_lynn_spears_casey_ald-1.html |archive-date=August 15, 2009 |url-status=live }} and Spears moved out in December 2009.{{cite news |last1=Dennis |first1=Alicia |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Moves out ‚Äì and Moves on with New Guy |url=https://people.com/celebrity/jamie-lynn-spears-moves-out-and-moves-on-with-new-guy/ |access-date=20 May 2023 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=February 7, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206154106/http://people.com/celebrity/jamie-lynn-spears-moves-out-and-moves-on-with-new-guy/ |archive-date=December 6, 2017 |language=en}} The couple reconciled in August 2010,{{cite news |last1=Oh |first1=Eunice |title=Are Jamie Lynn Spears and Casey Aldridge Getting Back Together? |url=https://people.com/celebrity/are-jamie-lynn-spears-and-casey-aldridge-getting-back-together/ |access-date=20 May 2023 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=August 13, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170303071254/http://people.com/celebrity/are-jamie-lynn-spears-and-casey-aldridge-getting-back-together/ |archive-date=March 3, 2017 |language=en}} but ended their relationship a second time in November 2010.[http://www.torontosun.com/entertainment/celebrities/2010/11/10/16072476-wenn-story.html "Jamie Lynn, Aldridge split"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220204136/http://www.torontosun.com/entertainment/celebrities/2010/11/10/16072476-wenn-story.html |date=December 20, 2016 }}. ''Toronto Sun''. November 10, 2010. Retrieved November 13, 2010. The announcement of Spears' pregnancy generated controversy, with criticism centering on the story purportedly glamorizing [[teenage pregnancy]].{{cite magazine |title=Teen Pregnancy: OK!'s Editor Defends Spears Cover |url=http://www.newsweek.com/id/145837 |magazine=[[Newsweek]] |access-date=July 14, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080716043021/http://www.newsweek.com/id/145837 |archive-date=July 16, 2008 |url-status=live }}{{cite news |title=Jamie Lynn Spears' New Motherhood Role Seems Glamorized In New Magazine Interview |publisher=All Headline News |url=http://www.allheadlinenews.com/articles/7011557419 |access-date=July 14, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081218100724/http://www.allheadlinenews.com/articles/7011557419 |archive-date=December 18, 2008 |url-status=live }} Some teens were disappointed with the contrast between Spears' on-screen personality as a "good" girl and her real-life teen pregnancy.{{Cite news|last=Rimer|first=Sara|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/21/us/21girl.html|title=TV's Perfect Girl Is Pregnant; Real Families Talk|date=December 21, 2007|work=The New York Times|access-date=February 22, 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170715092200/http://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/21/us/21girl.html|archive-date=July 15, 2017|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} On June 4, 2008, while in [[Amite County, Mississippi]], the Spears family filed a complaint against Edwin Merrino, a [[paparazzi|paparazzo]] who, they believed, was stalking the couple. Merrino denied the allegation. He was released later in the day after posting bond.{{Cite news|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/Shutterbug_Accused_of_Stalking_Jamie_Lynn/15692|title=Shutterbug Accused of Stalking Jamie Lynn|last=Finn|first=Natalie|date=June 4, 2008|agency=E! News|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120605053129/http://www.eonline.com/news/Shutterbug_Accused_of_Stalking_Jamie_Lynn/15692|archive-date=June 5, 2012|access-date=August 8, 2011}} After her daughter's birth, Spears disappeared from the public eye for five years, focusing on raising her child.{{Cite web|last=Young|first=Julius|date=October 19, 2020|title=Jamie Lynn Spears says she was 'mortified' to tell parents about first pregnancy at 16|url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/jamie-lynn-spears-mortified-tell-parents-pregnancy-16|access-date=October 20, 2020|publisher=[[Fox News]]|language=en-US|archive-date=October 20, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201020094237/https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/jamie-lynn-spears-mortified-tell-parents-pregnancy-16|url-status=live}} In an interview with ''Nylon'', Spears said: "So, I got me a little house. I put a big gate up around it, and I was like, 'I'm going to stay here, raise my baby, and figure this out because this is real life. I've put myself in this situation, I'm not condoning it or saying it's right, but these are the cards that I have to play.' And I tried to do the best that I could." === Marriage and family === She subsequently began a relationship with Jamie Watson, a businessman who owns the communications service Advanced Media Partners. After two years of on-and-off dating, they announced their engagement in March 2013.{{cite web|last=Shachat |first=Sarah |title=Who Is Jamie Lynn Spears's Fiance, Jamie Watson? |url=http://www.wetpaint.com/news/articles/who-is-jamie-lynn-spears-fiance |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130926005157/http://www.wetpaint.com/news/articles/who-is-jamie-lynn-spears-fiance |url-status=dead |archive-date=September 26, 2013 |publisher=[[Wetpaint]]|access-date=December 23, 2013 |date=March 3, 2013 }}{{cite magazine| url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jamie-lynn-spears-engaged-to-jamie-watson-see-her-ring-201323| title=Jamie Lynn Spears Engaged to Jamie Watson: See Her Ring!| magazine=[[Us Weekly]]| date=March 2, 2013| access-date=March 2, 2013| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130305054100/http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jamie-lynn-spears-engaged-to-jamie-watson-see-her-ring-201323| archive-date=March 5, 2013| url-status=live}} On March 14, 2014, she married Watson in New Orleans.{{cite news|title=Jamie Lynn Spears Marries James Watson in New Orleans|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/521081/jamie-lynn-spears-marries-james-watson-in-new-orleans?dlvrit=79438|agency=E! News|access-date=March 14, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171020084451/http://www.eonline.com/news/521081/jamie-lynn-spears-marries-james-watson-in-new-orleans?dlvrit=79438|archive-date=October 20, 2017|url-status=live}} On April 11, 2018, Spears gave birth to her second daughter.{{cite news |last1=Juneau |first1=Jen |last2=Michaud |first2=Sarah |title=It's a Girl! Jamie Lynn Spears Welcomes Daughter Ivey Joan |url=https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-welcomes-daughter-ivey-joan-first-photo/ |access-date=20 May 2023 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=April 12, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412191139/http://people.com/babies/jamie-lynn-spears-welcomes-daughter-ivey-joan-first-photo/ |archive-date=April 12, 2018 |language=en}}{{cite news |last1=Schnurr |first1=Samantha |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Gives Birth to Baby No. 2: It's a Girl! |url=https://www.eonline.com/news/926941/jamie-lynn-spears-gives-birth-to-baby-no-2-it-s-a-gir |access-date=20 May 2023 |work=[[E!]] |date=April 12, 2018}} ====ATV incident==== On February 5, 2017, Spears' eight-year-old daughter Maddie almost drowned in a Polaris [[All-terrain_vehicle|ATV]] accident, after accidentally driving into the pond on her stepfather and mother's Louisiana property, with the ATV flipping over upon impact. She was later airlifted to [[Children's Hospital of New Orleans]], where she remained unconscious in a coma for two days. She woke up and was released from care on February 10.{{Cite web |last=Petit |first=Stephanie |date=March 6, 2017 |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Reflects on 'Living a Mother's Worst Nightmare' One Month After Daughter's Accident |url=https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-reflects-daughter-maddies-accident-emotional-post/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210727223713/https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-reflects-daughter-maddies-accident-emotional-post/ |archive-date=July 27, 2021 |access-date=July 27, 2021 |publisher=People (magazine)}} Police reported the incident as occurring before 3:00 p.m. on a Sunday afternoon, and the sheriff explained that she was steering "100 yards from her parents" when she took "a hard right to avoid running over a nearby drainage ditch". The police report stated, "The child was trapped and secured by the seatbelt and the ATV's safety netting. Within two minutes, Acadian Ambulance Services arrived and assisted in freeing the child from the cold waters."{{Cite web |author=Jordan Runtagh and Elizabeth Leonard |date=March 6, 2017 |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Watched Daughter Maddie, 8, Crash ATV into Pond But Couldn't Rescue Her, Police Say |url=https://people.com/country/jamie-lynn-spears-daughter-maddie-critical-condition-submerged-pond-atv-accident/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210728065731/https://people.com/country/jamie-lynn-spears-daughter-maddie-critical-condition-submerged-pond-atv-accident/ |archive-date=July 28, 2021 |access-date=July 27, 2021 |publisher=People (magazine)}} In 2020, Spears explained the situation further. She elaborated that she and her husband Jamie Watson "[...] dove in and [...] were able to rescue her," then the first responder took her away. The firefighter was able to get a pulse, but her case looked "grim at the time", leading to her being airlifted to the hospital.{{Cite web |last=Chung |first=Gabrielle |date=May 4, 2020 |title=Jamie Lynn Spears Tears Up as She Shares Heartbreaking Details About Daughter Maddie's ATV Accident |url=https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-tears-up-details-daughter-maddie-atv-accident/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210727223421/https://people.com/parents/jamie-lynn-spears-tears-up-details-daughter-maddie-atv-accident/ |archive-date=July 27, 2021 |access-date=July 27, 2021 |publisher=People (magazine)}}{{cite magazine |last1=Nelson |first1=Jeff |last2=Leonard |first2=Elizabeth |title=Jamie Lynn Spears' Daughter Recovers from Near Drowning |url=http://ew.com/news/2017/02/07/jamie-lynn-spears-daughter-recovers-near-drowning/ |url-status=live |magazine=Entertainment Weekly |language=en |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190416014820/https://ew.com/news/2017/02/07/jamie-lynn-spears-daughter-recovers-near-drowning/ |archive-date=April 16, 2019 |access-date=November 21, 2019}} === Feud with Britney Spears === In 2021, Jamie Lynn and her sister Britney were involved in a highly publicized feud via social media. Britney publicly accused Jamie Lynn of actively and knowingly being involved in her conservatorship, while not making any efforts to help her terminate it. Jamie Lynn denied the allegations and maintained that she was unaware of the details of the conservatorship. Britney threatened legal action against Jamie Lynn after the latter spoke extensively about Britney in both her book and the following promotional tour.{{Cite web|title=Britney Spears accuses father of financial misconduct; threatens sister with legal action|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/jan/19/britney-spears-accuses-father-of-financial-misconduct-threatens-sister-with-legal-action|url-status=live|website=[[The Guardian]]|date=January 19, 2022 |access-date=January 21, 2022|archive-date=January 21, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051438/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/jan/19/britney-spears-accuses-father-of-financial-misconduct-threatens-sister-with-legal-action}} == Filmography == === Film === {| class="wikitable" !
